body:
Output of `helm version`: 
```
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.2.2", GitCommit:"a6ea66349ae3015618da4f547677a14b9ecc09b3", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.13.12"}
```

Output of `kubectl version`: 
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"18", GitVersion:"v1.18.0", GitCommit:"9e991415386e4cf155a24b1da15becaa390438d8", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2020-03-25T14:58:59Z", GoVersion:"go1.13.8", Compiler:"
gc", Platform:"windows/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"17", GitVersion:"v1.17.5", GitCommit:"e0fccafd69541e3750d460ba0f9743b90336f24f", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2020-04-16T11:35:47Z", GoVersion:"go1.13.9", Compiler:"
gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.): Kubernbetes in Rancher on vSphere

I installed an application using the upgrade command...
```
helm upgrade toggleservice .\ToggleService-1.0.30.tgz --install --wait --description "Manual deploy"
```
And after if I view the history the description was ignored...
```
REVISION        UPDATED                         STATUS          CHART                   APP VERSION     DESCRIPTION
1               Sun Jun  7 10:18:58 2020        deployed        ToggleService-1.0.30    1.0.133         Install complete
```

If I use the install command like so...
```
helm install toggleservice .\ToggleService-1.0.30.tgz --wait --description "Manual deploy"
```
The description is not ignored...
```
REVISION        UPDATED                         STATUS          CHART                   APP VERSION     DESCRIPTION
1               Sun Jun  7 10:19:54 2020        deployed        ToggleService-1.0.30    1.0.133         Manual deploy
```

What I expect to happen is when a description is provided to the upgrade command it is used. It works fine for subsequent upgrades but not the initial install.
